references.paper_title: Additive quantization for extreme vector compression
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on vector compression techniques, which are central to the paper's application in vector databases.
Bell's work on exponential polynomials underpins the mathematical foundation for analyzing the efficiency of the proposed compression algorithm.
Cover's seminal textbook provides essential information-theoretic principles and concepts that inform the theoretical underpinnings of the algorithm's optimality.
Duda's work introduces the Asymmetric Numeral Systems (ANS) entropy coding method, which is a core component of the paper's efficient compression approach.

references.paper_title: A method for the construction of minimum-redundancy codes
references.reason: Huffman's algorithm is a foundational method in data compression, providing a baseline for evaluating the efficiency of the RCC algorithm proposed in this paper.
